summary: An internal FBI communication from August 2, 2019, documenting the return of Jeffrey Epstein's suitcases and property to a private investigator acting on behalf of Epstein's legal counsel. The return was verified item-by-item and photographed, with a formal FBI 302 report to follow.

persons.name: Frank Senerchia
persons.context: Identified as the private investigator who received Epstein's property on behalf of Epstein's legal counsel, verified the items against the property receipt, and provided identification.

connections.description: Senerchia acted as a private investigator on behalf of Epstein's legal counsel to receive Epstein's property from law enforcement.

events.title: Return of Epstein's Property
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein's suitcases and property were returned to a private investigator, Frank Senerchia, acting on behalf of Epstein's legal counsel. The return was verified item-by-item, photographed, and documented.

events.title: Consultation with Legal Counsel
events.description: The FBI team consulted with Epstein's legal counsel the night before the property return.

keyFacts: Jeffrey Epstein's personal property (suitcases and other items) was returned to his legal team via private investigator Frank Senerchia on August 2, 2019.
The return process was meticulously documented, including item-by-item verification against a property receipt, photography of Senerchia's ID, and photos of him signing receipt forms.
The communication indicates ongoing legal and investigative activity related to Epstein shortly before his death in August 2019.
The document is an internal FBI communication from the New York Child Exploitation/Human Trafficking Task Force, subject to a protective order.
